alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Fayette; Madison; Pickaway; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 12:19PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN FAIRFIELD, NORTHEASTERN FAYETTE, PICKAWAY, SOUTHEASTERN MADISON AND NORTHERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 100 PM EDT... At 1219 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near New Holland, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Chillicothe, Washington Court House, Circleville, Mount Sterling, South Bloomfield, Kingston, Williamsport, Bloomingburg, New Holland, Logan Elm Village, North Folk Village, Frankfort, Fox, Stoutsville, Clarksburg, Tarlton, Darbyville, Deer Creek Lake, Chenoweth and Austin. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 81 and 88. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
